info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 3:35PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS POSSIBLE FOR THE ALBUQUERQUE METRO AREA, SOUTH CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, AND THE INTERSTATE 40 CORRIDOR FROM MORIARTY TO THE TEXAS STATE LINE... Winter Storm Warnings and Winter Weather Advisories are currently in effect across western and northern New Mexico late this evening through early Friday morning. Moderate to heavy snow will create hazardous travel conditions in these areas. In the meantime, light snow accumulations are expected within the Albuquerque metro area, starting around daybreak on Thursday and continuing into the late afternoon hours. Accumulations should remain under an inch, or one to two inches in the northeast heights of Albuquerque. This could result in slick road conditions during the morning and evening commutes. Meanwhile, one to two inches of snow is possible in the Estancia Valley and south central highlands, including the U.S. Highway 60 corridors. Precipitation across Guadalupe, Quay and Curry counties will likely start as a mix of rain and snow, eventually switching over to all snow from west to east on Thursday evening. One to two inches of snow is possible in this area as well, especially along the Caprock. Much heavier snow is favored in areas north of the Interstate 40 corridor. If this storm system tracks further south than currently projected, then greater impacts may be felt along this main transportation corridor. Travelers should stay tuned to forecast updates as this system moves across New Mexico. Travel conditions can change rapidly in short distances. For the latest New Mexico road conditions visit nmroads.com or dial 5-1-1.
